bill.title: Proposing amendment to Oregon Constitution relating to Senate confirmation of appointments.
bill.description: Proposes amendment to Oregon Constitution to prohibit holders of appointed offices that require Senate confirmation from holding over beyond conclusion of term of office or four years in office, whichever is less, unless Senate confirms appointed officer for succeeding term of office or succeeding four-year period. Proposes amendment to Oregon Constitution to prohibit holders of appointed offices that require Senate confirmation from holding over beyond conclusion of term of office or four years in office, whichever is less, unless Senate confirms appointed officer for succeeding term of office or succeeding four-year period. Refers proposed amendment to people for their approval or rejection at next regular general election.

history.action: Introduction and first reading. Referred to President's desk.
